name: (1Z)-1-[(2E)-1-benzyl-3-phenyl-2-(phenylhydrazono)propylidene]-2-phenylhydrazine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-960
Reason: 1. The basic unit for our comparison will be benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). 2. The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of a phenyl group, which tends to increase the melting point due to the enhancement of the crystalline structure and the increase in molecular weight. In addition, the compound contains a benzyl group, which can also contribute to the melting point due to the presence of a bulky aromatic ring. The phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100°C to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight. The benzyl group can be estimated to add approximately 20°C due to the presence of a bulky aromatic ring. 3. The compound also contains a hydrazine group, which can increase the melting point due to the presence of hydrogen bonding and the formation of a rigid structure. The hydrazine group can be estimated to add approximately 20°C to the melting point due to the formation of a rigid structure and the presence of hydrogen bonding.
